components.description:
An umbrella that is closed, likely as a result of collapsing it prior to going indoors.

Shows as purple on Apple and Samsung devices, as well as on Twitter. It is blue on Google devices and Facebook, and green on WhatsApp.
components.title: Closed Umbrella

description:
An umbrella that is closed, likely as a result of collapsing it prior to going indoors.

Shows as purple on Apple and Samsung devices, as well as on Twitter. It is blue on Google devices and Facebook, and green on WhatsApp.
title: Closed Umbrella

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Weather, landscape, and sky symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: An umbrella that is closed, likely as a result of collapsing it prior to going indoors. Shows as pink on Apple devices, blueÂ on Android, and http://emojipedia.org/closed-umbrella/
emoji_net_data.name: closed umbrella

bn:00006808n: The atmospheric conditions that comprise the state of the atmosphere in terms of temperature and wind and clouds and precipitation
The day-to-day meteorological conditions, especially temperature, cloudiness, and rainfall, affecting a specific place.
Unpleasant or destructive atmospheric conditions, and their effects.
Weather is the state of the atmosphere, to the degree that it is hot or cold, wet or dry, calm or stormy, clear or cloudy.

bn:00078920n: An umbrella or parasol is a canopy designed to protect against rain or sunlight.
A portable, foldable, waterproof, bell-shaped device which is held above the head in order to be shielded from the rain.
Cloth-covered frame used for protection against rain or sun.
Canopy designed to protect against rain or sunlight

bn:00028809n: Drizzle is a light liquid precipitation consisting of liquid water drops smaller than those of rain-generally smaller than in diameter.
Very light rain; stronger than mist but less than a shower

bn:00066032n: Precipitation in the form of liquid water drops with diameters greater than 0.5 millimetres.
Water falling in drops from vapor condensed in the atmosphere
Rain is liquid water in the form of droplets that have condensed from atmospheric water vapor and then precipitated -- that is, become heavy enough to fall under gravity.
Condensed water falling from a cloud.
The amount of rain that falls on a single occasion
Water which falls as rain from clouds.
Liquid water in the form of droplets that have condensed from atmospheric water vapor and then precipitated.
Rain is liquid precipitation, as opposed to non-liquid kinds of precipitation such as snow, hail and sleet.

apple_vendor_description: The closed umbrella emoji on Apple devices presents a sleek, sophisticated silhouette, rendered in a deep navy blue with a subtle sheen that hints at its waterproof capabilities. Its smooth, rounded fabric is neatly folded, showcasing Appleâ€™s signature realistic lighting and soft gradients that give it a tangible, almost tactile quality. This emoji elegantly conveys preparedness for inclement weather or signifies protection and shelter in digital conversations.
